intro: Oldenlandia aemulans, commonly known as the mimic mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling other plants, a trait that may aid in pollination. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Oldenlandia aemulans typically grows in moist, shaded areas, such as along stream banks and in forest understories.
